p: The best predictor of malignancy of a solid nodule is its size and growth rate. [ 26] From a mean diameter of 6 mm it starts to increase steadily. [ 27] The prevalence of malignancy in nodule <5 mm is extremely low, about half a percent. [ 28] In the NELSON trial, the risk of malignancy in subjects with nodules <100 mm 3 was similar to those without nodules. [ 29] Based on these data, the lower size threshold for nodules that require follow up was increased to 6 mm or 100 mm 3 in the Fleischner society guidelines [ 6] and 5 mm or 80 mm 3 in the BTS guidelines.
